Publication Abstract: Background: Metastatic breast cancer is a deadly disease with a low 5-year survival rate. Tracking metastatic spread in living patients is difficult and thus poorly understood. Methods: Via rapid autopsy, we have collected 30 tumor samples over 3 timepoints and across 8 organs from a triple-negative metastatic breast cancer patient. Publication Title: Phylogenetic inference from single-cell RNA-seq data
Publication Authors: Xuan Liu, Jason I Griffiths, Isaac Bishara, Jiayi Liu, Andrea H Bild, Jeffrey T Chang
Publication Abstract: Tumors are comprised of subpopulations of cancer cells that harbor distinct genetic profiles and phenotypes that evolve over time and during treatment. By reconstructing the course of cancer evolution, we can understand the acquisition of the malignant properties that drive tumor progression.
